ref: 5054 CHUP ʻ touch ʼ. [Derivation by P. Tedesco Or. Lit. 1932, 534 < sśr̥p -- metath. of spr̥ś -- receives some support from the Pk. variants chuvaï, chivaï, chavēi. But more prob. it is a deriv. (with generalized ch -- ) of *sqeup<-> in OEng. sceofan, scufan and Khot. (S. Konow, Saka Studies 181) sku -- ʻ to touch ʼ, skuta ʻ touch ʼ if < *squp -- , *squpti -- . -- For list of poss. enlargements of IE. *sqeu<-> see √sku]
